adjectives.description: supersensible (comparative more supersensible, superlative most supersensible)

entries.meaning: Beyond the range of what is perceptible by the senses; not belonging to the experienceable physical world.
examples: The imagination, therefore, must furnish to religion and to metaphysics those large ideas tinctured with passion, those supersensible forms shrouded in awe, in which alone a mind of great sweep and vitality can find its congenial objects.

entries.meaning: Extremely sensible; excessively sensitive or aware of something.
examples: […]  the patriotic zeal officially evinced by Claggart had somewhat irritated him as appearing rather supersensible and strained.
